author: RealityDue9779
text: As an iranian i wish best lucks for Usa in the next game because this team is supported by a killer obligatory islamic government that kills and tortures protestors

author: EdwardBigby
text: By not singing the anthem, weren't they protesting against the government regime?

author: bananaishClock
text:
They didn't sing the anthem because of public pressure, but deep down they are mullah bootlickers.
Today many iranians are mourning the loss of their children who participated in protests, and yet these 11 animals cheered like they're in a wedding  after scoring 2 goals.
They're are NOT representing iran they're mullah's team.

text: Bullshit

text: Bro please shut the fuck up

author: worldcup-ModTeam
text: Posting content that is not relevant to the World Cup is a violation of our rules.

author: hassanshaheenn
text: Can't you guys stop talk about politics for a second and support playing fucking football goddamit

author: EdwardBigby
text: Mate there's no separating them. The team represents a country which is a political entity. They start a game by singing a national anthem, they wear a crest representing the country and they wave flags representing the country. It literally all revolves around politics. You can't just separate them.

author: big_tentaclez
text: Does the US team represent the regime that drone strikes weddings and uses enhanced interrogation techniques on innocents then?

author: normalmisha
text: Yes.  You can't separate them.  Keep up.

author: lethalmc
text: Yes how else do you expect the US to win

author: EdwardBigby
text:
The US team represents the nation of America

That nation contains a lot of positives and a lot of negatives. You can make your own mind on whether you support them.

author: big_tentaclez
text: So the Iranian team only represents the negative aspects of Iran, but it's "pick and choose" for the US team? Cool, got it.

author: EdwardBigby
text: Why are you trying to put words in my mouth? The Iranian team represent the nation of Iran. The good and the bad.

author: rosacruxemburg
text: FR, the US has spread more misery death and destruction in the middle east in the last two decades than Iran has since its inception. Yes, we can critique our governments and love our teams and the competition.

author: EdwardBigby
text: Whether you believe Iran is a better nation than the US is up to you. I'm just saying that politics is what makes a nation. The whole concept of a nation is a political concept.

author: [deleted]
text:
The specific person who commented might not have been implying this but yes that seems to be the consensus.

Supporting the Iranian national team = supporting the regime and all of its policies.

Supporting the US = just supporting the team completely separate from, to name just one thong, US support for the war and man-made famine in Yemen

author: normalmisha
text: So why doesn't the USA team protest the US government's misdeeds?

author: EdwardBigby
text: Youd have to ask them themselves

author: normalmisha
text: Eh? How can *I* ask them *themselves*? ğŸ¤”

author: EdwardBigby
text: Well you get me there. I can defend my logic but not my grammar

author: hassanshaheenn
text: And they are players just like you and me who loves playing football and trying their best for their country. Support them just as you support soldiers in war

author: EdwardBigby
text:
War is actually a very good comparison. I'm not going to comment "Guys can write stop getting political and just watch the war" because there's no separating these 2 concepts. They intertwine.

And for that reason, I'm not going to support any army if I don't support the politics behind the army. If my nation was in a war I disagreed with politically then I wouldn't support the solders.

text: It should be simple; any country where Apostasy can still be a punishment is not civilized & should not be supported.
